hedline.hl1: MCI to Begin Review Of an Account

abstract.p: MCI WorldCom begins review of its long-distance subscription advertising account, with billings estimated at $70 million (S)

block.p: MCI WorldCom, the consumer unit of WorldCom, said yesterday that it had begun a review of its long-distance subscription advertising account, with billings estimated at $70 million.
MCI WorldCom, the consumer unit of WorldCom, said yesterday that it had begun a review of its long-distance subscription advertising account, with billings estimated at $70 million.

Leland Prince, a spokeswoman for MCI in Arlington, Va., confirmed a report of the decision this week in Advertising Age and Adweek. The account has been handled by Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer/Euro RSCG in New York, part of the Euro RSCG Worldwide unit of Havas Advertising, which also continues to handle many other assignments for MCI like the business-to-business account and transaction brands like the 1-800-COLLECT account.

Several agencies, including Messner Vetere, are being invited to take part in the review; a final decision is expected in two months. Greg Jones, a spokesman at Messner Vetere, said the agency would participate.
